name: pangenome-comparative-genomics
title: Pangenome: Comparative Genomics & Core/Accessory Analysis
description: Pangenome analysis of bacterial genomes to identify core genes (present in all strains) and accessory genes (variable). Uses Panaroo/Roary for comparative genomics, evolution, and epidemiology studies. Samplesheet format: `sample,fasta`
content:
Pangenome Analysis

Pangenome analysis compares multiple bacterial genomes to identify the complete gene repertoire of a species: core genes (present in all), accessory genes (variable), and unique genes (strain-specific).

Applications

  • Pathogen Evolution: Track AMR gene spread
  • Outbreak Investigation: Identify outbreak-specific genes
  • Vaccine Development: Find conserved antigens (core genes)
  • Species Definition: Genomic boundaries of species

Key Outputs

  • Core Genome: Genes in all strains (phylogenetic backbone)
  • Accessory Genome: Variable genes (adaptation, virulence)
  • Gene Presence/Absence Matrix: Binary matrix for all genes
  • Phylogenetic Tree: Based on core genome SNPs

Perfect for: Bacterial comparative genomics • Outbreak investigation • AMR tracking • Vaccine targets
